definition[0]: to include something as part of a group, system, plan etc
example[0]: We’ve incorporated many environmentally friendly features into the design of the building.
example[1]: Our original proposals were not incorporated in the new legislation.
definition[1]: if a company is incorporated, it is listed officially as a company by meeting certain legal REQUIREMENTs which apply in a particular country or a particular state. Companies which are incorporated become CORPORATIONs
example[2]: Zapata Trading was founded in 1986 and incorporated in 1989.
example[3]: The law gave corporations that are incorporated in Pennsylvania 90 days to opt out of certain provisions.
definition[2]: to include or add something to a group, system, plan etc
example[4]: Volvo hopes to incorporate Japanese concepts of worker participation.
example[5]: Apple Computer agreed to incorporate Adobe’s printer software in the basic program for all Macintosh PCs.
